text: I AM BACK!
The supreme evil is back, rather unsubtle with his huge pyramid and huge hat.
The First of the Vampires is an ancient and wicked soul, a beguiling and terrifying foe.
Ancient angels of Ptra, Nagash's pettiness in victory. The Morghasts are intelligent and powerful servants of the Great Necromancer.
The most powerful Hammurai of Ptra are turned into willing emissaries of Nagash, spearheads of doom.
The tireless watch of Nagashizzar, ancient blades sharpened on Skaven skulls.
Powerful wights and guards of Nagash's fortress, vicious and strong enough to cut intruders and human cattle in half.
Bones are certainly a resource in abonedance.
Nightmarish constructs built of stone, metal and bone walk the halls of Nagashizzar, graceless bodies devoted to a single murderous purpose.
Whatever beasts these used to be, they had big fangs and bigger claws, only made sharper in undeath.
For too long these Ghouls have lived in the Dhar-saturated warpstone mines of Nagashizzar.
Spirits of death, wielding tools of death, riding on birds of death. Nagash isn't one for inspiration.
Ancient Tomb unearthed by powers of Black Pyramid, containing an endless supply of skeletons.
A grotesque and violent Necrolith, as much of a construct as it is rock and graveyard.
Spirit Hosts are a common sight amongst the armies of the dead, a horde of ethereal ghosts that swarm across the battlefield.
Spectres are in many ways the malevolent counterparts of Ghosts, angry beings full of malice for the living and despair at their own state.
Walk through the dark sepulchral forests and woodlands of the world and you will hear the wails of the disembodied spirits that haunt these locations.
The legends of all lands and races tell of the Plague Cart, but whether it is of this world or another, none can say...
Ancient bones of long vanquished wights, possessed and puppeteered by malicious spirits who are older still.
These chariots were a parody of those used by Nagash's opponents, constructed from bone and sinew, held together by the power of Dark Magic.
Thick bones, running towards you, screaming without vocal cords, yup that's a Dead Orc.... but it's running towards me.
Goblins, bad enough when they just have sticks but these ones have bows pointing at you, did I mention they were undead?
Goblins, bad enough when they are alive, but these ones are dead and are still pointing sticks at you.
Up close, a Troll will batter foes into submission or vomit disgusting... wait a second, aren't these guys dead?
It's a 500lb lean mean bone machine, and you're on the menu.
A bellowing, cursing display of raw might, ruthless aggression and mindless savagery. It's only mission is to feed it's hunger, but what do the dead hunger for?
These risen dead carry sharp scythes, curved blades with long handles that make them an ideal weapon for reaping souls and severing the ties between the living and the dead.

The deathless warriors of the Doomed Legion have fought at Krell's side since their mortal days. When they were alive, they fought for the glory of Khorne, but in death the Doomed Legion serve Nagash no less faithfully than their chieftain.
Wild, feral things; heavily manacled and chained, so that only when the time was right would they be unbound and set forth to unleash their infinite rage against their foes.
Having recently been given the gift of vampirism, these thralls cannot be trusted within the heat of battle so must settle for weapons require little more skill than the ability to point and shoot.
The Bloodkiss fresh on their necks and the taste of blood consuming their every thought, the sound of gunpowder is sure to snap them back to reality.
Burned by the fires of hell along with their whole village, these cursed souls seek the living to inflict as much pain as they themselves suffered
Ancient and wise beyond her countless years, Genevi√®ve is about the only vampire welcome -if grudgingly- in all the human royal courts of the Old World
